Name: Mosaic of the River God Alpheus
Description: The colored mosaic shows a scene inspired by Greek mythology, the story of the river god Alpheus. His name is inscribed beside him on the left of the scene. The nude young man standing on the left pursued the nymph Arethusa, who fled from him to Syracuse in Sicily. Many colored tessarae, which are small pieces of marble, glass, or tile, were used to execute this beautiful mosaic.
